articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Syrian President
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on the 47th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					 Extending warm congratulations to the president and the government and people of Syria, he in the message said that the corrective movement was a historic event of weighty significance in the struggle of the Syrian people to build an independent and prosperous new society.
					
					 The message wished the president, the government and people of Syria bigger successes in their just cause for defending the sovereignty, security and territorial integrity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Vice FM Blasts Australian PM's Insult to DPRK
articles.content:
DPRK Vice FM Blasts Australian PM's Insult to DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Choe Hui Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, issued the following press statement on Nov. 16:
					 Lately, the Australian prime minister has been continuously letting out a stream of invective against the DPRK while zealously following the U.S. in the extreme sanctions and pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 At a press interview held in Hong Kong of China on November 12, he talked nonsense that "north Korea is one of the most crafty and sophisticated criminal states that raise funds for nuclear program through illicit means including weapon and drug trafficking and cyber-crime, and a criminal organization operating under the name of a state." And he appealed to all countries attending the East Asia Summit to "intensify economic and financial sanctions against north Korea" while claiming that "united and collective pressure would bring north Korea back to its senses."
					
					 His impudent condemnation of the dignified DPRK as a criminal organization is exactly in line with the reckless threat made by Trump on the UN podium to totally destroy our country, and it constitutes a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and an intolerable insult to its people.
					
					 An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth is the way I ought to respond to the Australian prime minister who hurled unreasonable abuse at the DPRK in defiance of international norms of etiquette and courtesy.
					
					 The Australian prime minister should fully understand that uttering paradoxical remarks at different places and dispatching armed forces to the U.S. nuclear war drills targeting the DPRK are only adding to the sins that Australia had committed against the Korean people during the Korean War.
					
					 For the prime minister of a country he is, he should deliberate whether or not his baseless condemnation of the DPRK and impetuous participation in the U.S.-led sanctions and pressure against the DPRK would do any good to the interests and desire of his people cherishing peace and justice, and seriously ponder over the consequences that an inappropriate remark he makes could bring to his own political career.
					
					 Now in Australia there are strong voices of condemnation that the present government is providing benefits to the U.S. supremacy and arms sale while bringing great danger to Australia by pursuing the U.S. foreign policy like a "sleepwalker", and they are demanding that the prime minister clarify his stand to refrain from joining the U.S. aggressive and provocative military maneuvers and that the prerogative to use armed forces on the Korean peninsula be transferred to the Federal Parliament.
					
					 It is not surprising that the prime minister is being ridiculed in the neighboring countries as "a paper cat hiding behind a paper tiger labelled Trump", "Trump's mouthpiece" and "a second class Western citizen" who would be shy to be the second in groveling to Trump.
					
					 The Australian prime minister should give up the daydream that some sort of "unity" and "pressure" could check the advance of the DPRK which is marching forward under the high banner of self-development, and he should watch his mouth in light of the brilliant reality and the invincible might of the DPRK.
					
					 The Australian prime minister had better mind the business within his own country rather than being a marionette of the U.S.

articles.title: Letter to UN Secretary-General
articles.content:
Letter to UN Secretary-General
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to the United Nations sent a letter to the UN secretary-general on Nov. 13 in denunciation of the U.S. nuclear war exercises aiming at the DPRK.
					 After deploying three nuclear powered aircraft carrier strike groups in waters around the Korean peninsula, the U.S. staged another joint military exercises with south Korea. And it reactivated round-the-clock emergency sortie system of nuclear capable strategic bomber B-52, which existed during the Cold War era, and is maintaining a surprise strike posture with frequent flight of B-1B and B-2 formations to the air space of south Korea.
					
					 Recalling the facts, the letter said:
					
					 The U.S. flung the words of "total destruction" of a sovereign state at the UN General Assembly, the world largest official forum of diplomacy, and is now running amok for war exercises by introducing nuclear war equipment in and around the Korean peninsula. This goes to prove that the U.S. itself is a chief offender of the escalation of tension and undermining of peace.
					
					 The large scale nuclear war exercises and blackmails, which the U.S. have staged for a whole year without a break in collaboration with its followers to stifle the DPRK, make one conclude that the option we have taken was quite right and that we should go along the way to the last.
					
					 Despite this fact, the UN Security Council, whose mission is to ensure the world peace and security, keeps turning a blind eye to the nuclear war exercises of the U.S. which is hell-bent on bringing a catastrophic disaster to humanity, thereby giving rise to a serious concern on the double standard of the UNSC.
					
					 In this regard, in view of the world justice and impartiality, we kindly request the secretary-general to give your viewpoints as to the following questions:
					
					 Question 1; Do the nuclear war exercises in and around the Korean peninsula being undertaken by the U.S. for a whole year without a break at all targeting a sovereign state conform to the purpose of the UN Charter, which is to maintain peace and security？
					
					 Question 2; Since the DPRK and the U.S. are legally in a state of armistice as belligerent parties as yet, does the questioning in the UNSC of the self-defensive measures of one belligerent party, the DPRK only as a "threat", ignoring the nuclear war provocative acts of the other belligerent party, the U.S., conform to the principle of sovereign equality of the UN Charter？
					
					 We would like to politely request the secretary-general to give right answers to the questions raised in conformity with the requirement of the UN Charter and the mission of the UN Secretariat who is holding the impartiality and independence as its lifeline. At the same time we ask the secretary-general to bring to the attention of the UNSC under Article 99 of the UN Charter, regarding the danger being posed by the U.S. nuclear war exercises which are clearly threats to international peace and security.

articles.title: Moldovan President Supports Korean People's Struggle
articles.content:
Moldovan President Supports Korean People's Struggle
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Kim Hyong Jun met with Moldovan President Igor Dodon on Nov. 13.
					 The president said:
					
					 We are rejoiced over the fact that in recent years the relations between Moldova and the DPRK and the Party of Socialists in the Republic of Moldova and the Workers' Party of Korea are developing on good terms.
					
					 We extend support to the Korean people in their struggle for defending the country's sovereignty and achieving the economic development.
					
					 We will strive to develop the friendly relations with the DPRK and boost cooperation with it on the international arena.

articles.title: Swedish Institute Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Swedish Institute Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Swedish Institute for Security and Development Policy led by Director Niklas Swanstrom left here for home on Thursday.
					 The delegation had exchange of views about the issues of Korean peninsula situation and the bilateral ties with officials of the Disarmament and Peace Institute and the European Department of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, and had a talk with officials of the National Peace Committee of Korea.

articles.title: Japanese Buddhist Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Buddhist Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A Japanese Buddhist delegation led by Raitei Arima, director general of the Kyoto Buddhist Society of Japan, arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations and Delegates of Juche Idea Study Organizations Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations and Delegates of Juche Idea Study Organizations Here
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests came here Thursday to participate in the 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists.
					 They include Harish Gupta, vice director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party, a delegation of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea led by Advisor Garib Newaz, a delegation of the Mongolian Mt Paektu Association for Independent Development led by D. Enkhbadralt who is a member of its Leadership Council, Alexandr Vorontsov, vice-chairman of the Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and DPRK's Policy, Economy and Culture, and his party, Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Andre Lohekele Kalonda, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Arriving earlier were Takao Kamakura, director of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party and scholars from various Chinese social science institutes and universities.

articles.title: Participants of 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants of 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The participants of the 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The visitors went round the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum and the historic relics at the old home of the President, recalling his revolutionary career.
					
					 They also visited the Korean Revolution Museum.
					
					 Looking at the photos of the President and leader Kim Jong Il in various rooms, they grasped the undying exploits they performed by illuminating the road to be followed by the Juche-based social science.
					
					 At the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt Taesong they laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk and paid tribute to her.
					
					 Then the participants toured the Sci-Tech Complex and Ryomyong Street.

articles.title: Maritime Control System Established
articles.content:
Maritime Control System Established
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The fishery sector of the DPRK has established the new maritime control system based on latest science and technology and properly operated it, thus putting fishing on a scientific basis.
					 By introducing this system, the Kim Chaek Taegyong General Fishery Enteprise is catching fish over 1.2 times more as compared with the same period of last year.
					
					 Basing itself on a detailed survey of fishing conditions, weather and marine situation on the East Sea of Korea, the enterprise completed the program for maritime control system. It has installed ultra shortwave and shortwave antennas and satellite receiving antennas to send data to fishing boats in time.
					
					 It has also established a dual power supply system with tens of solar panels to ensure the safety of transmission.
					
					 And all the fishing boats are equipped with computers and horizontal and vertical shoal detectors.
					
					 Bearing in mind that scientific fishery precisely means big fish haul, and one of the basic guarantees for big fish haul lies in putting the fishing industry on a scientific and modern basis, fishery stations across the country are making successes in fishing by dint of latest science and technology.

articles.title: Mother's Day in DPRK
articles.content:
Mother's Day in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- November 16 is Mother's Day in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The happiness of family and the future of the nation lie in bringing up sons and daughters into true human beings, revolutionaries devoting themselves to the country and the people. This is the noble outlook on happiness and future the mothers of this country cherish.
					
					 Among them are a mother on Kubong Pass who put forward her all sons and daughters as road keepers while working as a road keeper for several decades, a woman scientist who devoted herself to the agricultural development of the country and a patriot who has cultivated green woods in a remote mountain recess with her husband.
					
					 Our revolutionary ranks are growing stronger as there are many diligent and tender-hearted mothers who sent their sons and daughters to the posts for defending the country and bring up orphans as they would do their own children, and mothers who devote themselves to the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un puts on the meridian of happiness and glory the mothers who bring up children, the future of the country, while pushing one of the two wheels of the revolution.
					
					 He is successfully carrying forward the noble intention of the great leaders who brought the flower garden of respecting the women. He saw to it that November 16 was instituted as Mother's Day. President Kim Il Sung delivered a speech "The Duty of Mothers in the Education of Children" at the 1st National Meeting of Mothers on November 16, 1961.
					
					 Kim Jong Un made sure that the 4th National Meeting of Mothers was held on the occasion of the first Mother's Day in Juche 101 (2012) and had a photo session with the participants of the meeting.
					
					 On the significant Mother's Day every year, all the sons and daughters of the country extend warm congratulations to the mothers bringing up their children with their love, feelings and devotion and upholding the socialist country.

articles.title: Dozens of Women Awarded Labor Hero Title in DPRK since 1990s
articles.content:
Dozens of Women Awarded Labor Hero Title in DPRK since 1990s
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Since the 1990s, dozens of women were awarded the title of Labor Hero in the DPRK for giving birth to many children.
					 Kim Kwang Ju and Pang Ok Song respectively gave birth to eight children and let all of them join the army.
					
					 Kim Si Nyo in Wiwon County of Jagang Province and Pak On Jon in Un Ryul County of South Hwanghae Province gave birth to 14 and 8 children each and brought them up to be robust offspring, thereby fulfilling their duty as mothers.
					
					 Ri Hui Sun in Onsong County of North Hamgyong Province and So Hye Suk in Mangyongdae District of Pyongyang took warm care of orphans as their real mothers would do when the country weathered hardships, thus giving full play to the spiritual and moral traits of the Korean women.
					
					 Ri Myong Son, Ri Ok Bun, Jong Pok Nyo, Yu Jong Sil, Kang Jong Suk and Cha Chun Son, too, brought up dozens of orphans.
					
					 Pak Ok Dan, Mun Jong Sun, Song Kum Suk and four other women became heroines with the 4th National Conference of Mothers as an occasion.
					
					 Ranks of patriotic women bringing up their children as reliable pillars of prosperous Korea are expanding as the days go by as they follow the examples set by true heroines who gave birth to many children and brought them up to be pillars of the country and cared for the pain of others as their own.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Dismisses U.S.-S. Korea Military Nexus Aggressive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Dismisses U.S.-S. Korea Military Nexus Aggressive
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. deployment of THAAD in south Korea under the pretext of "nuclear threat from the north" is aimed to contain big powers bordering the Korean peninsula and gain its unchallenged position in Asia-Pacific, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a article.
					 What matters is the U.S. has betrayed its attempt to deploy another THAAD, not content with the deployment of one THAAD in south Korea, the article says, adding:
					
					 The additional deployment of THAAD by a briganish order of the U.S. is a matter of time.
					
					 The U.S. is pressurizing the south Korean puppet regime to mend fences with Japan in a bid to form the U.S.-Japan-south Korea tripartite military alliance but it only poses a threat to peace and stability in the peninsula and Northeast Asia.
					
					 Under the scenario of the U.S., the relationship of military cooperation between south Korea and Japan has almost reached the phase of alliance. The triangular military alliance has been practically completed and is actually functioning, threatening peace on the Korean peninsula and Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S. is plugging the south Korean puppet regime into the building of the all-inclusive missile defence system in Asia-Pacific, stoking serious concern at home and abroad.
					
					 The U.S. is now engrossed in high-handed and arbitrary practices in order to use the south Korean authorities as a shock brigade for invading the DPRK and realizing its strategy of dominating the world. Meanwhile the puppet authorities are blindly toeing their master's line, being hell-bent on pro-U.S. and treacherous acts. In the long run, peace in the Korean peninsula and the region has been put to serious peril and the danger of a nuclear war mushrooms day by day.

articles.title: Struggle for Punishment of Lee Myung Bak Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Punishment of Lee Myung Bak Unabated in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- An anti-Lee Myung Bak struggle is gaining momentum in south Korea, according to news reports from Seoul.
					 Recent disclosure of the crimes committed by Lee Myung Bak included the building up of public opinion through the mobilization of military organs, interference in the "presidential" election and squandering huge money collected from the people as taxes under the pretext of voluntary diplomacy and the illegal operation of a company.
					
					 The ruling Democratic Party and organizations of various social standings branded this as a political scandal as serious as the hideous political scandal of Park Geun Hye.
					
					 Much upset by the spearhead of social movement for the removal of evils being directed to them, the Lee Myung Bak group are protesting it as "political retaliation" and attempting to rally the conservative forces.
					
					 Such attempt has greatly enraged the south Koreans from all walks of life.
					
					 The candlelight demonstration and rally for the earlier detention of Lee Myung Bak that began in the area near the house of the traitor by the "Commando for Seizing MB" and the Headquarters of All-People Action to Punish Lee Myung Bak and other organizations have stretched into several days and those from different parts of south Korea joined them.
					
					 At the rally representatives of various organizations stressed that without detention of Lee Myung Bak, there can never be the removal of evils.
					
					 They evinced their pledge not to stop struggle until Lee is put under custody.
					
					 A lawmaker from the ruling party involving in the candlelight demonstration disclosed that Lee Myung Bak squandered 100 trillion won through corruption, typically four-river improvement project and voluntary diplomacy, during his seizure of office.
					
					 An internet signature campaign of citizens began on Nov. 10, urging the authorities to stop Lee Myung Bak's foreign trip.
					
					 The members of the "Commando for Seizing MB" held a demonstration at Inchon Airport to protest Lee's foreign trip.
					
					 Voices denouncing Lee are also heard from politicians from ruling and opposition parties.
					
					 The south Korean media including Yonhap News reported it is predicted that Lee Myung Bak will be summoned for investigation within this year.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Protests U.S. Imperialists' Nuclear War Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Protests U.S. Imperialists' Nuclear War Exercises
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of Anti-Trump, Anti-U.S. Struggle in south Korea held a rally outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Nov. 14 to protest the war exercises against the north staged by the U.S. imperialists with the involvement of nuclear carrier task forces, according to Minjok Ilbo, south Korean internet newspaper.
					 The speakers at the rally recalled that the U.S. staged military exercises with the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" keen on militarist revival and reinvasion of Asia after the introduction of huge forces, and held war exercises against the DPRK with the puppet forces in south Korean waters of the East Sea of Korea.
					
					 Those dangerous exercises may spill over into the third world war and become a seed of a nuclear war, they said.
					
					 The flame of actions against Trump, U.S. and war will flare up as anti-U.S. resistance, they said, declaring that the headquarters would make a breakthrough in the resistance against Trump and the U.S.
					
					 The organization made public a statement and thrust a letter of protest to the U.S. embassy.

articles.title: LKP Flailed for Opposing Removal of Evils in S. Korea
articles.content:
LKP Flailed for Opposing Removal of Evils in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Taejon Headquarters of Movement for Achieving People's Rights and Removing Evils of south Korea held a press conference on Nov. 15 to condemn the "Liberal Korea Party" for standing against the abolition of evils and the social reform, according to Tongil News, a south Korean internet newspaper.
					 Speakers at the conference branded the LKP as the chieftain of all evils, disclosing that it propped up the traitorous regime by building up the public opinion over "security crisis" and misled the public after putting the broadcasting under control.
					
					 It is illogical for the LKP to describe the removal of evils as a "political retaliation" as it created all evils of society, they said.
					
					 A press release said that evil doings of Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye have seriously threatened society, adding the LKP was already sentenced to death politically.
					
					 The members of Taejon branch of the press trade union also took part in the press conference and disclosed the crimes of the LKP which insulted the strike of the trade union.

articles.title: Stop to North-targeted Joint Military Exercises Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to North-targeted Joint Military Exercises Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration in a commentary on Nov. 15 demanded that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces stop large-scale war exercises Key Resolve, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 The "government" describes the Key Resolve as an "annual and defensive drill" but it is widely known as the one aimed at a preemptive attack on the north, the commentary said.
					
					 It urged the authorities to stop the war exercises which will increase military tension and the U.S. to halt all military actions.

articles.title: Strong Earthquake Jolts North Kyongsang Province, S. Korea
articles.content:
Strong Earthquake Jolts North Kyongsang Province, S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A strong quake measuring 5.5 on Richter Scale reportedly hit Phohang City, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea on Wednesday.
					 The quake was strong enough to be felt across south Korea including Seoul.
					
					 In Phohang, many buildings collapsed and dozens of citizens were injured.

articles.title: "Denuclearization of North" Can Not Be Condition for Dialogue: Federation of Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
"Denuclearization of North" Can Not Be Condition for Dialogue: Federation of Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. on Nov. 11 issued a commentary urging Trump to have proper attitude to the DPRK-U.S.
					 The commentary said Trump keeps getting on the nerves of the DPRK after he set out on his Asian junket aimed at war agitation and forced sale of weapons.
					
					 The U.S., Japan and the south Korean authorities are holding war exercises with the mobilization of three nuclear carrier task forces under the pretext of "threats from the north", the commentary said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. does not propose an equal dialogue without conditions but is creating environment and conditions unfavorable for holding dialogue as evidenced by the announcement of its "independent sanctions" and the rhetoric of rattling the DPRK such as criticism of the "human rights" performance and social system.
					
					 The "denuclearization of the north" can never be a condition for dialogue, the commentary said, stressing that dialogue among nations have to be held on an equal footing, not as the one affected by threat and blackmail.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. stop slandering the DPRK but make substantial efforts for the DPRK-U.S. dialogue.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK on November 8.
					 Lebedev, chief of the group, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 8 to Dec. 17 and decided to introduce Kim Jong Il's career and feats and organize political and cultural events in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- An Indian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in New Delhi on Nov. 7.
					 Atul Kumar Anjan, secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 8 to Dec. 17 and decided to hold political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's exploits for the human cause of independence in the period.

articles.title: Trump's Visit to S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Trump's Visit to S. Korea under Fire
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- British bodies made public statements on Nov. 7 to blast U.S. President Trump's visit to south Korea.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Korean Friendship Association UK and the British Solidarity Committee for the Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula issued a joint statement lashing out at Trump's mad remarks against the DPRK, branding his south Korea visit as a junket by a war servant.
					
					 The joint statement ridiculed the present south Korean regime as the puppet of the U.S. like the previous one, as it welcomed Trump in a coquettish manner despite the public protests and denunciation.
					
					 The Staffordshire Branch of the Korean Friendship Association UK said in a statement that war maniac Trump's visit was aimed to launch an anti-DPRK campaign, and urged him to pull out the U.S. aggression forces from south Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Bashar al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Bashar al-Assad
Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion al Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					 La misiva va como sigue:
					
					  Tengo el honor de extender calidas felicitaciones a Vd. y al amistoso gobierno y pueblo de su pais con motivo del aniversario 47 del Movimiento de Rectificacion en Siria.
					
					  Este movimiento fue un evento historico de capital importancia para la lucha del pueblo arabe de Siria por construir una nueva sociedad independiente y prospera.
					
					  Aprovechando esta oportunidad, deseo de todo corazon mayores exitos en el cumplimiento de la justa causa de Vd., el gobierno y pueblo sirios para defender la soberania, la seguridad y la integridad territorial del pais.

articles.title: Vicecanciller coreano condena disparates de premier australiano
articles.content:
Vicecanciller coreano condena disparates de premier australiano
Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Choe Hui Chol, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, hizo publica el dia 16 una declaracion siguiente:
					Estos dias, el premier australiano no deja de pronunciar los chismes contra la RPDC sumandose activamente a la extremada campana de sancion y presion de EE.UU.
					
					En una rueda de prensa ofrecida el dia 12 en Hong Kong, el maldijo que "el Norte de Corea es uno de los paises criminales mas astutos y adiestrados del mundo que prepara el fondo necesario al plan nuclear mediante el contrabando de armas y drogas, los crimenes ciberneticos, etc. y la organizacion criminal que se opera con el nombre del Estado. Y exhorto a "todos los paises participantes en la Cumbre de Asia Oriental a recrudecer las sanciones economica y financiera contra el Norte de Corea e insistio en que todos unidos debe dar presion a la RPDC para que esta se volviera en si.
					
					El disparate de ese tipejo australiano quien se atrevio a describir la RPDC como organizacion criminal tiene algo en comun con las peroraciones de Trump que hablo de la destruccion total de nuestro Estado en la escena de la ONU y, por esta razon, deviene la violacion flagrante a la soberania de nuestro Estado y el insulto intolerable a nuestro pueblo.
					
					Puesto que el ha ofendido arbitrariamente a nuestro Estado sin tomar en su consideracion alguna las cortesias internacionales, yo tambien me veo obligado a cuestionar con el mismo tono sus tonterias.
					
					El primer australiano debe tener presente que sus sofisterias lanzadas durante su viaje y el envio de las fuerzas armadas a los ejercicios de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC de EE.UU. multiplican el crimen cometido contra el pueblo coreano durante la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					Como el fuera premier, debe meditar que su difamacion injusta sobre la RPDC y su alistamiento con las maniobras de EE.UU. de dar la sancion y presion contra la RPDC fueran convenientes a los intereses y la voluntad del pueblo de su pais que aprecia la paz y la justicia. Tambien, hay que reflexionar de la influencia que sera creado en su destino politico por su lapsus linguae.
					
					En el interior de Australia salen las insistencias en que el gobierno actual persigue como "sonambulo" a la politica exterior de EE.UU. mientras que da ganancias a las maniobras de este pais americano por el establecimiento de la hegemonia y la venta de armas y trae el gran peligro a su pais. Y le demandan al premier poner en claro su posicion de no participar en las provocativas maniobras militares de EE.UU. y entregar al Parlamento Federal el derecho al uso de las fuerzas armadas en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Hasta los paises regionales burlan que el premier australiano estaria disgusto si lo ponen en el segundo lugar en la adulancia a Trump, describiendolo como "gato de papel ocultado detras de Trump, tigre de papel", "trompetero de Trump" y "ciudadano de segunda clase del Occidente". 
					
					 El premier australiano debe liberarse de la absurda ilusion de detener con la supuesta "unidad" y "presion" el camino del pueblo coreano que avanza apoyandose en la idea de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento y hacer con prudencia sus pronunciaciones y actos viendo correctamente la realidad hermosa y el gran poderio de la RPDC.
					
					Para el seria mejor abandonar su papel del titere de EE.UU. y cuidarse solo de los trabajos de su casa.

articles.title: Representante coreano envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
articles.content:
Representante coreano envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El representante permanente de la RPDC ante la ONU remitio el dia 13 al secretario general de la ONU una carta para acusar el entrenamiento de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. contra la RPDC.
					EE.UU. realizo los ejercicios militares conjuntos con el Sur de Corea tras ubicar 3 flotillas de portaaviones nucleares en las aguas perifericas de la Peninsula Coreana y reactivo el sistema de despegue emergente de 24 horas de B-52 que existia solo en el tiempo de Guerra Fria, comienza la misiva y prosigue:
					
					Mantiene ademas la disposicion de ataque sorpresivo contra la RPDC mandando repetidamente al cielo sobre la region surcoreana las escuadrillas de B-1B y B-2.
					
					De veras, el culpable principal del empeoramiento de la situacion y la destruccion de paz es EE.UU. que se refiere a la "destruccion total" de un Estado soberano hasta en la Asamblea General de la ONU, escenario diplomatico oficial mas importante del mundo, y se dedica a los ejercicios militares introduciendo de continuo los pertrechos de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y sus alrededores.
					
					El entrenamiento de guerra nuclear de gran envergadura, que desarrollan sin parar a lo largo del ano EE.UU. y su satelite, confirma que el camino optado por la RPDC fue mil veces justo y hay que recorrerlo hasta el final.
					
					Lo problematico es la actitud de doble rasero del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, que a pesar de su mision principal de garantizar la paz y seguridad internacionales, se obstina en hacer vista gorda de los simulacros de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. que impondrian tremendos desastres a la humanidad.
					
					La carta exigio al secretario general de la ONU exponer en claro su criterio sobre algunos problemas desde el punto de vista de la justicia internacional y la imparcialidad.
					
					Primero, ?convienen al objetivo de la Carta de la ONU sobre el mantenimiento de paz y seguridad los entrenamientos de guerra nuclear que EE.UU. libra sin parar a lo largo del ano en la Peninsula Coreana y sus alrededores contra un Estado soberano?
					
					Segundo, ?conviene al principio de igualdad de la soberania, estipulado en la Carta de la ONU, la conducta del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, que ignora las tentativas de guerra nuclear de una parte beligerante y cuestiona como "amenaza" las correspondientes medidas de autodefensa de la otra cuando la RPDC y EE.UU. se encuentran en el cese de fuego en sentido legal?
					
					Esperamos que el secretario general de la ONU nos de una respuesta correcta conforme a la demanda de la Carta de la ONU y a la mision del Secretariado de la ONU, que considera como su vida la imparcialidad y la independencia, y llame la atencion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU sobre la peligrosidad del entrenamiento de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. que constituye una amenaza evidente para la paz y seguridad internacionales en virtud del articulo 99 de la Carta de la ONU.

articles.title: Presidente de Moldavia apoya la lucha del pueblo coreano
articles.content:
Presidente de Moldavia apoya la lucha del pueblo coreano
Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC, Kim Hyong Jun, se reunio el dia 13 con el presidente de la Republica de Moldavia, Igor Dodon.
					En la ocasion, el mandatario moldavo expreso satisfaccion de que se desarrollaran positivamente en los ultimos anos las relaciones entre Moldavia y Corea y entre el Partido de Socialistas de la Republica de Moldavia y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Manifesto el apoyo a la lucha del pueblo coreano por defender la soberania del pais y lograr el desarrollo economico.
					
					Dijo que se esforzara por desarrollar las relaciones de amistad con la RPDC y fortalecer la cooperacion con ella en la escena internacional.
